entry.title: bitcoin DNS addresses
entry.summary: The discussion is about the best method for resolving Bitcoin addresses. One person suggests that DNS-based resolving is not a good idea due to the potential for man-in-the-middle attacks, and that DNSSEC is not an effective security measure in this situation because it would require its own DNSSEC-enabled stub resolver. The other person agrees with these points but thinks HTTPS is a better solution. They ask for a list of advantages of HTTPS so they can respond properly.
